snippet: Hoping to attract new capital, shareholders in the bank, based in Siena, Italy, voted to end a longstanding tradition of local control and patronage.
abstract: Shareholders of troubled Italian bank Monte dei Paschi di Siena vote to lift ownership restrictions and encourage new outside investors, ending five-century tradition of local control and patronage; move may lead to similar changes at Italy's other big banks.

byline.original: By GAIA PIANIGIANI and JACK EWING
byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani reported from Siena, Italy, and Jack Ewing from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Hoping to attract new capital, shareholders in the bank, based in Siena, Italy, voted to end a longstanding tradition of local control and patronage.

headline.main: Monte dei Paschi, Venerable Italian Bank, Yields to Change
headline.print_headline: Italian Bank Votes to End Tradition of Local Control

keywords.value: Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA
